What is 'base text direction'

Text direction - applicable for widgets which show text. 
Direction of text is critical for readability of that text especially in Bidi languages. 
For example: "hello world !!!" will be displayed as "!!! hello world" with RTL direction
Detailed explanation of what base text direction term means may be found on pages 5-9 of the following reference document:
 
 https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dDrSwimrQbpbXybhMYDEiJXLeeqvelnY4cc8HeCP1Nk/edit?usp=sharing

'Base text direction' (BTD) for bootstrap widgets

Only Toltip and Popover bootstrap widgets support BTD
since only these ones create their HTML markup dynamically.
Other widgets are based on existing HTML markup, therefore either 'direction' style
or 'dir' attribute may be used by createor of HTML page in order to achieve required BTD.

How to specify 'base text direction' for bootstrap widgets

Bootstrap widgets provide BTD basing on 'textdir' option been passed to widget constructor.
Alternatively BTD ma be specified declaratively as 'data-textdir' attribute of corresponding html element.

Allowed values are: "ltr" (left-to-right), "rtl" (right-to-left) and 
"contectual" (meaning that either 'ltr' or 'rtl' value is used depending on 
the first strong(Arabic/Hebrew or English) character of string been displayed.  

Note: The bootstrapBidi.js script file should be loaded, by side of primary bootstrap script
(either bootstrap.js or bootstrap.min.js) in order to enable 'base text direction support 
like in following illustrative snippet:

<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.3/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script src="../../dist/js/bootstrap.min.js"></script>  
<script src="../../dist/js/bootstrapBidi.js"></script>
